description: Learned borrowing from Latin impolītus. Equivalent to im- +‎ polite.

adjectives.description: impolite (comparative impoliter or more impolite, superlative impolitest or most impolite)

entries.meaning: Not polite; not of polished manners; wanting in good manners.
examples: Synonyms: discourteous, uncivil, rude, unpolite; see also Thesaurus:impolite
